result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle K Marvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Danielle K Marvin in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:57 AM. State - resolved - DRI #2, plead to count #1 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, employment/school, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or tavern, 25 hours of community service. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Marvin pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Laska makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendaion. Marvin withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or tavern, 25 hours of community service, fine of $100 plus costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction right given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Jury trial on May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle K Marvin in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:23 pm. Not resolved. Settlement is probable. Court explains setting for JT. State said that all discovery was sent by them. Defendant is doing own discovery. State offer count 1 DRI and count 2 w/held and probation for 12 months with costs. Court gives JT date.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle K Marvin in court with attorney Cana G Laska appearing telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:36 AM. Marvin was previously advised of charges and penalties, Laska has not gone over it with the defendant. Laska pleads NG to all counts, Marvin agrees. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Court appointed attorney paperwork filed, will adjourn to 2/24/16.

Defendant Danielle K Marvin in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:51 AM. Marvin has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Marvin understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, believes she qualifies for SPD. Court instructs to contact SPD and sets for AIA, given court appointed attorney form in court, instructs not to come back without an attorney. Court - bond - $500.00 signature bond - no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
